title: Postseason - Player Names in NLCS & ALCS
custom_preconds:
For 2017 postseason, player names for the cubs, dodgers, indians, nationals, astros, and yankees from the "Active" roster pages that are available in http://mlb.mlb.com/mlb/players/?tcid=nav_mlb_players

GIVEN user is in At Bat
AND is in Ask At Bat
custom_steps:
WHEN the user requests any player currently in the:
- NLCS (National League Championship Series)
- ALCS (American League Championship Series)

(test all)
custom_expected:
THEN bot responds with deeplink to the player card mlbatbat://athlete?player_id=[id] 
(i.e. mlbatbat://athlete?player_id=446308)
AND the user is taken to the requested player's card

title: Postseason - Misunderstood/Mispelled player Nicknames in NLCS & ALCS
custom_preconds:
See Attachment for List of 125 Player Names currently supported in 2017 postseason.  For 2017 postseason, player names for the cubs, dodgers, indians, nationals, astros, and yankees from the "Active" roster pages that are available in http://mlb.mlb.com/mlb/players/?tcid=nav_mlb_players

GIVEN user is in At Bat
AND is in Ask At Bat
custom_steps:
WHEN the user requests any player nickname currently in the:
- NLCS (National League Championship Series)
- ALCS (American League Championship Series)

(test all)
custom_expected:
THEN bot responds with deeplink to the player card mlbatbat://athlete?player_id=[id]
AND the user is taken to the requested player's card

title: Active Player Names
custom_preconds:

AND is in Ask At Bat
custom_steps: WHEN the user requests any active player
custom_expected:
THEN bot responds with deeplink to the player card mlbatbat://athlete?player_id=[id] 
(i.e. mlbatbat://athlete?player_id=446308)
AND the user is taken to the requested player's card

title: Historically Popular Player Names
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is in At Bat
AND is in Ask At Bat
custom_steps: WHEN the user requests any inactive historically popular player name
custom_expected:
THEN bot responds with deeplink to the inactive historically popular player card mlbatbat://athlete?player_id=[id]
AND the user is taken to the requested player's card

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user requests any inactive historically popular player name

•	Babe Ruth
•	Barry Bonds
•	Giancarlo Stanton
•	Hank Aaron
•	Cal Ripken
•	Mickey Mantle
•	Mark McGwire
•	Rickey Henderson
•	Sandy Koufax
•	Sammy Sosa
•	Joe DiMaggio
•	Old Hoss Radbourn
•	Tedd Williams

THEN bot responds with deeplink to the inactive historically popular player card mlbatbat://athlete?player_id=[id] 
(i.e. mlbatbat://athlete?player_id=121578)

AND the user is taken to the requested inactive player's card

title: Historically Popular Players with same Name
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is in At Bat
AND is in Ask At Bat
custom_steps:
WHEN the user requests any inactive historically popular player
AND there are multiple players with the same name
custom_expected:
THEN bot responds with deeplink to the inactive historically popular player card mlbatbat://athlete?player_id=[id]
AND the user is taken to the requested player's card

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user requests the player name:

 • Ken Griffey Senior
 • Ken Griffey Sr
custom_steps_separated.expected:

AND the user is taken to the requested player's card

title: Player names that sound like something else
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is in At Bat
AND is in Ask At Bat
custom_steps: WHEN the user request a player name and sounds like something else
custom_expected: THEN the user should get the deeplink and be directed to the corresponding player card

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user requests the player name Homer Bailey
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user should get the deeplink
mlbatbat://athlete?player_id=456701

AND be directed to the corresponding player card, 

User should not be taken to the stats page for Home Runs which it's synonym is 'homers'

title: For Fun
custom_preconds:
Old Hoss Radbourn, he’s a pitcher from the 19th century and now he lives on as a Twitter account written by someone who’s very funny — has a lot of followers. The general gist being that baseball players today are all wimps compared to — most especially — pitchers of the 19th century that threw 500 innings a season.

GIVEN user is in At Bat
AND is in Ask At Bat
custom_steps:
WHEN the user posses the following query:

Who is the most dapper hurler to ever play the old ball game?
custom_expected:
THEN the response is:

“There are many schools of thought, but lately I lean towards Old Hoss Radbourn and his 489 complete games.”
